lexUnit.name: toddle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: walk or go in a casual or unsteady way, as a child learning to walk

sentence.text: K : ` I am disappointed because although I bought a freezer there is only one power point in the kitchen so we ca n't use it -- an extension lead would be dangerous with Chloe toddling about .
Rachel was now in her second year , toddling about and growing sturdy of limb , and she had become very attached to her nurse .
So after toddling about for a while you go into Barries " and point out the shorts where they lie in the window , interleaved with their fellows .
` Well then , if you can promise it 'll be alright at Mona 's , let's toddle along there . "
Piper toddled along , holding the clown 's hand .
His back was to her , he was toddling along purposefully in the same direction as her , across that bleak empty landscape .

Little Horace Charles was carried off by pneumonia at the tender age of eight months , but Ernest William , Henry James and Herbert George were healthy young children crawling or toddling around those rooms in Wilmington Square .
I was toddling around at the time getting into mischief the way any normal , healthy three-year-old boy does .
This is not the moment to go toddling back to the office to fart about over some fine print in sub-clause seventy-nine with a bunch of anal-retentives from Accounts . "
From then on , every afternoon , as soon as her mother had left for bingo , Matilda would toddle down to the library .
His favourite relaxation was to toddle down to the quay and join the Royal Navy patrol boat for a day out .
They would go for a drink and then toddle off home . "
On reading such statements , would Ptolemy have seen the error of his ways , instantly recanted and toddled off to join the Copernican revolution ?
You do n't imagine we can simply walk out of here , do you ? -- win or lose , up stakes and toddle off back to the world of boiled cabbage and beds with sheets ?
` Just wanted half a minute with the chaps before you all toddled off , if I may , sir . "
` Do n't you think we ought to be toddling off ?
` And then he gave us the will and the other papers and he said to us , just before we toddled off to Morocco -- "
The kid toddled off like a drunk trying to balance two pints of beer .
Sometimes the little boy climbed from his cot and played for a while indoors , though more usually he toddled out on to the terrace , in search of her and a drink
A voice that called me ` old boy " suggested that I ` toddle over the road and meet me in Greenwich Village at the corner of Bleeker Street and MacDougal .
As fast as her rheumatic legs would carry her , she toddled round to the Rope Walk , to the house where Eb and Josh and Ruth had been born and brought up .
I 'm supposed to be resting , but after I 'd had forty winks , I felt a lot better , so I toddled over here .
Mel toddles up to a driver of a white Fiesta and gets out his wiper .
I toddled through the gate and made for the tree because it was studded all over with soft dark fruit .
I toddled through it when I was with Rhine Army .
Jonadab watched the child who toddled towards him .
AS Prince William began his second birthday celebrations with a photo call in the gardens of Kensington Palace , he toddled curiously towards a TV crew .
